name: Malaria
recommendations: Seek immediate medical attention for proper testing
Stay hydrated and get adequate rest
Take antimalarial medication as prescribed by doctor
Use mosquito nets and repellents to prevent reinfection

name: Typhoid Fever
recommendations: Consult a doctor immediately for antibiotic treatment
Maintain strict hygiene and wash hands frequently
Drink plenty of fluids and oral rehydration solution
Avoid solid foods until fever subsides

name: Pneumonia
recommendations: Seek immediate medical attention for proper diagnosis
Take prescribed antibiotics as directed
Get plenty of rest and stay hydrated
Use a humidifier to ease breathing

name: Tuberculosis
recommendations: Contact a healthcare provider immediately for TB testing
Complete full course of anti-TB medication if diagnosed
Maintain good nutrition and rest
Avoid close contact with others until cleared by doctor

name: Hypertension
recommendations: Monitor blood pressure regularly
Reduce sodium intake and maintain healthy diet
Exercise regularly and maintain healthy weight
Take prescribed blood pressure medications as directed

name: Diabetes
recommendations: Get blood sugar tested immediately
Follow a diabetic diet plan
Monitor blood glucose levels regularly
Take prescribed diabetes medication as directed

name: Asthma
recommendations: Use prescribed inhaler as directed
Avoid known asthma triggers
Keep rescue inhaler available at all times
Consult doctor for asthma action plan

name: Peptic Ulcer
recommendations: Avoid spicy, acidic, and fatty foods
Take prescribed acid-reducing medications
Eat smaller, more frequent meals
Avoid NSAIDs and alcohol

name: Hepatitis B
recommendations: Get liver function tests done immediately
Avoid alcohol completely
Get hepatitis B vaccination if not infected
Practice safe hygiene to prevent transmission

name: HIV/AIDS
recommendations: Get HIV testing done at a certified facility
Start antiretroviral therapy if positive
Practice safe sex and avoid sharing needles
Maintain good nutrition and regular medical care

name: COVID-19
recommendations: Isolate immediately and get tested for COVID-19
Monitor oxygen levels and breathing
Rest and stay hydrated
Seek medical attention if breathing difficulties worsen

name: Influenza
recommendations: Get plenty of rest and stay hydrated
Take antiviral medication if prescribed within 48 hours
Use pain relievers for aches and fever
Stay home to avoid spreading infection

name: Gastroenteritis
recommendations: Stay hydrated with oral rehydration solution
Follow BRAT diet (bananas, rice, applesauce, toast)
Avoid dairy and fatty foods temporarily
Seek medical help if severe dehydration occurs

name: Urinary Tract Infection
recommendations: Drink plenty of water to flush bacteria
Take prescribed antibiotics completely
Urinate frequently and after sexual activity
Avoid irritating feminine products

name: Arthritis
recommendations: Apply heat or cold therapy to affected joints
Maintain regular low-impact exercise
Take prescribed anti-inflammatory medications
Consider physical therapy for joint mobility

name: Depression
recommendations: Seek professional mental health counseling
Consider antidepressant medication if recommended
Maintain regular exercise and social connections
Practice stress reduction techniques

name: Migraine
recommendations: Rest in a dark, quiet room
Apply cold compress to head and neck
Take prescribed migraine medication early
Identify and avoid personal migraine triggers

name: Anemia
recommendations: Get blood tests to determine anemia type
Increase iron-rich foods in diet
Take prescribed iron supplements
Address underlying causes of blood loss

name: Stroke
recommendations: CALL EMERGENCY SERVICES IMMEDIATELY
Note the time symptoms started
Do not give food, water, or medication
Keep patient calm and lying down

name: Skin Infection
recommendations: Keep affected area clean and dry
Apply prescribed topical antibiotics
Take oral antibiotics if prescribed
Avoid scratching or picking at infection
